titleStmt.title: SII 2.70: original edition by Eugen Julius Theodor Hultzsch
No. 70. ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE EAST ENCLOSURE.

summary.p: This inscription consists of a list of villages in the Chōḷa country, which had to supply watchmen for the temple, in accordance with an order which Rājarājadēva had issued before the 29th year of his reign. The last paragraph (114) states that, owing to want of space, the inscription is continued on the south of “the gate of Rājarāja,” i.e., on the left of the entrance to the second gōpura. This missing portion is identical with the inscription No. 57, which professes to be the continuation of an incomplete inscription on the north of “the gate of Rājarāja,” i.e., on the right of the entrance to the second gōpura.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
Conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
ṅkaṅkapāṭiyuntaṭikaipāṭiyum nuḷampapāṭiyuṅkuṭamalaināṭuṅkollamuṅkaliṅkamum muraṭṭeḻil ciṅkaḷar Īḻamaṇṭalamum Iraṭṭapāṭi Eḻarai Ilakkamum muṉṉīrppaḻantīvu paṉṉīrāyiramuntiṇṭiṟal veṉṟittaṇṭāṟkoṇṭa taṉṉeḻil vaḷarūḻiyuḷellāyāṇṭuntoḻutaka viḷaṅkum yāṇṭe ceḻiyaraittecu koḷ korājakesa[riva]rmmarā[ṉa śrī]rājarājad[ Evark] ku yāṇṭu Irupattoṉpatāvatu varai Uṭaiyār śrīrājarājadevar Uṭaiyār śrīrājarājīśvaram Uṭaiyārkkuccoḻamaṇṭalattu brahma
vum Iṭṭa tirumeykāppārkaḷukkupperāl Āṭṭai vaṭṭaṉ nūṟṟukkalanelluttirumeykāppārkaḷai Iṭṭa Avvavar Ūrkaḷilāre Aḷakkakkaṭavārkaḷākavum Innel Avvavar Ūrkaḷilārkku candrādityaval Āṭṭāṇṭu toṟum taṉ kaṭamaikkuccelavu peṟavum paṭi celavu peṟavum Āka Ippaṭi nivantamāka Uṭaiyār śrīrājarājadevar tiruvāy moḻintaruḷiṉapaṭi kallil veṭṭiyatu 1 Arumoḻidevavaḷanāṭṭu Iṅkaṇāṭṭu vimalacittamaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum 2 Arumo
ḻidevavaḷanāṭṭu*] ṇalākiyaParagraph 5 of No. 9 and paragraph 3 of No. 69 show that before ṇalākiya we have to supply arumoḻidevavaḷanāṭṭu neṉmalināṭṭu neṭuma. mataṉamañcari[ ccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu*] 3 Innāṭṭukkuṉṟiyūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum 4 Arumoḻidevavaḷanāṭṭuppuṟaṅkarampaināṭṭuppallavaṉmahādeviccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum 5 Innāṭṭuccempiyaṉmahādeviccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum 6 Innāṭṭupperumpalamarutūr sabh[ Aiyā] r Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum 7 In
nāṭṭu ṅkalattu Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu 8 rkkūṟṟattucciṟṟāmūr Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum 9 Arumoḻidevavaḷanāṭṭu I ṭṭukkuṟukkai sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10*] Arumoḻidevavaḷanāṭṭu Aḷanāṭṭukkīḻaiyilākiya parameśvaramaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 1*] Innāṭṭuccempiyaṉmahādeviccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉ
ṟum [10 2*] kṣatriyaśikhāmaṇivaḷanāṭṭuttirunaṟaiyūrnāṭṭuttirunaṟaiyūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 3*] Innāṭṭuccīto māṉa Abhimānabhūṣa[ṇaccatu]rvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 4*] Innāṭṭu Āyakuṭi sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 5*] Innāṭṭu vaṇṭāḻañceri Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 6*] Innāṭṭukkūrūr Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 7*] Innāṭṭukkaṟkuṭi Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 8*] kṣatriyaśikhāmaṇivaḷanāṭṭucceṟṟūrkkūṟṟattucceṟṟūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [10 9*] Innāṭṭukkuṭavāyil sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [2 10*] Innāṭṭu nā

ppu Oṉṟum [3 10 3*] Innāṭṭuttañcāvūr Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [3 10 4*] kṣatriyaśikhāmaṇivaḷanāṭṭuttiruvārūrkkūṟṟattu Āṭiyappimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [3 10 5*]

kkāṭṭūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [8 10*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭukkārnāṭṭu O r sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [8 10 1*] taṉiyūr śrīvīranārā[yaṇacca]turvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykā
ppu Āṟum [8 10 2*] rājendrasiṁ[havaḷan]āṭṭukkuṟukkaināṭṭukkuṟukkai sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [8 10 3*] Innāṭṭukkāvirimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [8 10 4*] Innāṭṭukkāṭṭiyārbrahmadeyattu sa
bhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [8 10 5*] Innāṭṭu varakūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu [8 10 6*] Innāṭṭukkaṭalaṅkuṭi sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [8 10 7*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭuttiruvālināṭṭu mallikuṭi

runaṉṟiyūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 1*] Innāṭṭu māṟa[ piṭukudevi] ccaturvvedima[ ṅgalattu sabhaiy] Ār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 2*] Innāṭṭukkañcāṟanakar Ūrār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 3*] rājendrasi
ṁhavaḷanāṭṭuṭhis name looks more like veṉṉaiyūr in the original; but see No. 69, paragraph 104. veṇṇaiyūrnāṭṭupperuṅkaṇpūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 4*] Innāṭṭu mātulaveḷūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 5*] Innāṭṭu ttūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 6*] In
nāṭṭu veḷḷūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 7*] Innāṭṭuccotiyakkuṭi sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 8*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭuttirukkaḻumalanāṭṭu Utaiyādi[tyaccatu]rvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava
tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [9 10 9*] Innāṭṭuttirukkaḻumalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100*] Innāṭṭutteṉūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 1*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭu nāṅkūrnāṭṭu nāṅkūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirume
ykāppu Iraṇṭum [100 2*] Innāṭṭukkuṉṟattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 3*] Innāṭṭu marutūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 4*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭu Atikaimaṅkaināṭṭupperuntoṭṭattu sabhaiyā
r Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Iraṇṭum [100 5*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭukkoṇṭanāṭṭuppañcavaṉmahādeviccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Iraṇṭum [100 6*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭu neluvūrnāṭṭukkumarātittyaccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhai
yār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 7*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭuppiṭavūrnāṭṭu nayatīramaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 8*] rājendrasiṁhavaḷanāṭṭu vecālippāṭi jayaṅkoṇṭacoḻaccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakka
ṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 9*] rājendrasiṁ[ha]vaḷanāṭṭu Iruṅkoḷappāṭi vaḷavaṉmahādeviccaturvvedimaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Oṉṟum [100 10*] rājāśrayavaḷanāṭṭu mīymalai mahendramaṅgalattu sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumey
kāppu Oṉṟum [100 10 1*] rājāśrayavaḷanāṭṭu vaṭavaḻināṭṭuttiruveḷḷaṟai sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirumeykāppu Iraṇṭum [100 10 2*] rājāśraya- vaḷanāṭṭuppācciṟkūṟṟattukkīḻpalāṟṟupperumarutūr sabhaiyār Iṭakkaṭava tirume
ykāppu Oṉṟum [100 10 3*] poyīṭu Ivviṭattu nilam potātāka Itil kuṟai rājarājan tiruvācalil teṟkuRead agni ? Aṅṅidevar Ālaiyattukku vaṭakku Ātipūmiyiṟkapotattiṉ kīḻppuṟaṉil Uttara What remains of the letters in this break, looks like pparakulata. tuṭaṅkikkallil veṭṭittu .. [100 10 4*]

1. [Hail! Prosperity!] Before the twenty-ninth year (of the reign) of Kō-Rājakēsarivarman, alias Śrī-Rājarājadēva, who, etc.,The preserved portion of line 1 shows that the historical part of this inscription was identical with that of No. 65. —the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva [was pleased to order that the inhabitants of the] brahma[dēyas] in Śōṛa-maṇḍalam [should supply temple watchmen] to the lord of the Śrī-Rājarājēśvara (temple).Those portions of the preceding sentence, which are enclosed in square brackets, are lost at the beginning of line 2, but can be supplied with the help of the analogous wording of No. 69, paragraph 1. To each of the temple watchmen who are supplied, the inhabitants of the respective villages which have supplied the temple watchmen, shall measure one hundred kalam of paddy per year. This paddy has to be supplied and daily allowances (paḍi) have to be paid every year, as long as the moon and the sun endure, out of the tax due by the inhabitants of the respective villages. These allowances were engraved on stone by order of the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva.
2. The members of the assembly of [Vima]lachittama[ṅgal]am in I[ṅ]ga[ṇā]ḍu, (a subdivision) of Arumoṛidēva-vaḷanāḍu, have to supply one temple watchman.
3. [The members of the assembly of Neḍumaṇa]l, alias Madanamañjari-[chaturvēdimaṅgalam, in Neṉmali-nāḍu], (a subdivision) of Arumo[ṛidēva-vaḷanāḍu, have to supply • • temple watchman].
4. The members of the assembly of Kuṉṟiyūr [in the same nāḍu] have to supply one temple watchman.

114. Pōyīḍu.The same three obscure syllables are found at the beginning of the continuation of this inscription on page 227, where I had been unable to make them out owing to the injured condition of the stone, and had transcribed them as po • [śrī]. Though the meaning of the word pōyīḍu is unknown, its occurrence in both places suggests that it is meant for a cross reference from the last paragraph of No. 70 to the first paragraph of No. 57. As the space at this spot is not sufficient, the portion which is missing here, was engraved on stone to the south of the sacred gate of Rājarāja, to the north of the shrine of A[gnid]ēva, on the lower portion (?), on the east wall of the enclosure (?), commencing from the northern • • •
